column6: Use-Case for which this solution is particularly problematic

column2: Train the model using less data from the majority class. Example: use only 10% of data from the majority class (e.g. White people’s data)
column4: Model not skewed towards majority classes
column5: Overall model performance will be lower; model may no longer predicted accurately for the groups which were subsampled
column6: If the Use-case says this is considered to be a relatively low volume of data & model’s overall performance will affect net lives

column1: Weighting under-represented classes more when training model
column2: Data from these groups will update the model’s decision making significantly. Give different weights to different groups to ensure equitability.
column4: Model not skewed towards majority classes
column5: Overall model performance will be lower
column6: If the Use-case says model’s overall performance will save lives and/or the dataset has been used in other pipelines and has been concluded there is a lot of bad/missing/data without signal.

column1: Adding small amount of  randomization to model’s decision making
column2: Makes model less prone to favouring one class over another in its predictions/accuracy of its predictions.
column4: Model performs equitably/better for under-represented social groups
column5: Overall model performance will be lower
column6: If the Use-case says model’s overall performance will save lives and/or the dataset has been used in other pipelines and has been concluded there is a lot of bad/missing/data without signal. If Use-case says interpretability of model is important so it can be adopted by other group (reason: model perturbations may lead to lack of interpretabiltiy)

column1: Collect data to complement existing training data
column2: Get training data to enrich the existing training dataset and compensate for imbalances
column4: Model performs better equitably/better for social groups
column5: If training data wasn’t collected from a similar time-frame and source as the original, it may add noise to the model
column6: If the Use-case says volume of data is relatively high. OR If the Use-case mentions that the model needs to be rolled out ASAP to save lives.

column1: Optimize for fairer  metric across demographics
column2: Instead of training a model to optimize for overall accuracy, you could optimize for a score that factors in each subgroup. In other words, model predicts accurately for each demographic.
column4: Model performs better equitably/better for social groups
column5: Overall model performance will be lower; model may overfit
column6: If the Use-case says this is a considered to be a relatively low volume of data (overfitting risk) & model’s overall performance will affect net lives (is it better to save 1000 lives even if they are one race or 500 lives of different races)

column2: Use the training data for minority classes to train a synthetic data generation model which can generate more data for those classes.
column4: Model performs better equitably/better for social groups
column5: May upsample unwanted bias or noise for under-represented groups. May reduce model’s overall performance
column6: If the Use-case says this is a considered to be a relatively low volume of data (overfitting risk) & model’s overall performance will affect net lives
